block.name: Runtime CFO Control
block.doc:
Runtime Carrier Frequency Offset Control
Observes carrier frequency offset (CFO) estimations and makes sure that the \ the CFO is always within a correctable range. A CFO threshold is configured to this \ block and relates to the maximum CFO that can be estimated and, consequently, \ corrected in software. Once the CFO estimation at the input exceeds the threshold, \ the block changes the RF center frequency that should be used to alter the frequency \ in hardware (e.g. in the USRP/RTL) instead.
The reason why this block is used is because CFO estimation algorithms are only able \ to estimate CFOs within a certain range. In order to keep the CFO always within this \ range, one solution is to update the RF center frequency every time it exceeds the \ range. Once the center frequency itself is changed, the CFO with respect to the new \ center frequency (and not to the nominal center freq.) is close to 0, so that the \ CFO estimation algorithm will continue to be able to estimate the forthcoming CFOs \ properly. Note that this is useful when the CFO changes significantly over time, for \ example in the case when low-stability LNBs are used for satellite reception.
This block also combines well with a CFO estimation algorithm that relies on \ averaging when outputing CFO estimations. The *avg_len* parameter of this \ block is used to ensure that the output CFO estimation (the post-processed \ one) is non-zero only after the averaging transitory has passed.
Parameters: avg_len -> Transitory length of the CFO estimation averaging abs_cfo_threshold -> Threshold for the absolute value of the CFO rf_center_freq -> Nominal (or starting) RF center frequency
